original: Linnell, Gustaf Gideon, häradsskrivare, Jönköping, f. 5/5/80 i Jönköp. av fabr. Karl Henrik L. o. Betty Widell. G. 07 m. Elin Augusta Persson. Barn: Karl-Gustaf f. 08, Anna-Brita 10, Bengt 14, Gunnar 18, Karin 23. — Mog:ex. 01. E. o. landskont. 01-19, ord. 20, härads-skriv, i Njudungs fögd. 20, i Tveta, Vista o. Mo fögderi 30. Ordf. i taxind, led. av drätselkamm. Hobbies: violinspel o. violinbygge. RVO.
translated: Linnell, Gustaf Gideon, district clerk, Jönköping, b. 5/5/80 in Jönköping. Son of factory owner Karl Henrik L. and Betty Widell. Married in 1907 to Elin Augusta Persson. Children: Karl-Gustaf b. 1908, Anna-Brita b. 1910, Bengt b. 1914, Gunnar b. 1918, Karin b. 1923. Divorced in 1901. Acting deputy county administrator, 1901-1919, regular from 1920, district clerk in Njudung's district from 1920, in Tveta, Vista, and Mo districts from 1930. Chairman of the tax committee, member of the finance committee. Hobbies: playing the violin and building violins. Awarded the Royal Victorian Order (RVO).

structured.name: Gustaf Gideon Linnell
structured.biography: Gustaf Gideon Linnell was born on May 5, 1880, in Jönköping, Sweden. He was the son of factory owner Karl Henrik Linnell and Betty Widell. In 1907, he married Elin Augusta Persson, and they had five children together: Karl-Gustaf (born in 1908), Anna-Brita (born in 1910), Bengt (born in 1914), Gunnar (born in 1918), and Karin (born in 1923). Gustaf and Elin divorced in 1901. He worked as an acting deputy county administrator from 1901 to 1919 and became a regular county administrator in 1920. Gustaf served as a district clerk in Njudung's district from 1920, as well as in Tveta, Vista, and Mo districts from 1930. He was also the chairman of the tax committee and a member of the finance committee. Apart from his professional life, Gustaf had hobbies in playing the violin and building violins. He was honored with the Royal Victorian Order (RVO).
